discourse_list.title: Finding of new amount of gold in Uganda

content.content: Investigating as always on the internet several days ago, I came across quite interesting news, although I saw it more as something sensational, as the days went by it had more echo in the crypto community, I thought I’d share it Although it seems more like a rumor, it sounds quite interesting if it becomes real More than 300 thousand tons of gold were found in a Ugandan mine, practically doubling the total supply of extracted gold How much gold has been found in the world? | U.S. Geological Survey. It is not necessary to realize the hypothesis that a gold meteorite falls to cause the price of gold to fall, so with this it seems that the technology of cryptocurrencies with their finite extraction is once again taking the lead    MINING.COM    Uganda says exploration results show it has 31 million tonnes of gold ore Most of the deposits were discovered in Karamoja, a parched sprawling area in the country's northeastern corner on the border with Kenya.  Est. reading time: 2 minutes       China already went ahead and had started bilateral agreements with Uganda (pretty bad) https://www.mfa.gov.cn/ce/como//eng/news/t1580860.htm If the discovery is true and knowing the agreements that China has and at the same time how authoritarian China is with its agreements, how would this affect gold as a refuge value? And what role will cryptocurrencies have as a value escapement, or even as a future refuge value?

Bitcoin is hard money because you know exactly how many there are today and how many there will be in 10 years or 100 years, but with gold you don’t know because with the advance in space technology the mining of gold and other minerals on asteroids will increase the circulation of those resources, just recently I saw a project specialized in mining asteroids allying with spaceX.
Exactly, even coins with a high supply are safer in the future, you know how many there will be, but with minerals it will always be unknown, gold has the worst tokenomics after bloktopia hahahaha
